Statutory Eligibility Requirements for Retroactive Awards Under 38 CFR 3.114
The plain language of
38 U.S.C. 5110(g)
governing the effective date for a claim granted based on a favorable change in law and its implementing regulation requires two specific findings:
a liberalizing law or administrative issue was implemented, and
the ultimate grant of benefits was
pursuant to
such a favorable change in law.
The use of the words
pursuant to
indicates that the benefits of this provision apply only where the law or administrative issue is one which provides a substantive basis for establishing entitlement to benefits.
Note
:  The regulatory criteria, as discussed in
M21-1, Part V, Subpart ii, 4.A.6.h
, adds an additional requirement for eligibility.
Reference
:  For more information on the threshold for eligibility pursuant to a liberalizing law or issue, see
Brown v. Nicholson
, 21 Vet.App. 290 (2007).
